musicalLanguage.description: The legendary piano coda of Layla, composed by drummer Jim Gordon. One of the most beautiful piano passages in rock, it transforms a raw blues-rock song into something transcendent. The piece features a memorable ascending melody over rich chord changes, building from a gentle statement to a passionate climax.
musicalLanguage.structure: Piano Coda (8 bars) — C-C/E-F-F/A-Bb-C repeated with melodic development and embellishment
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The iconic ascending melody over C to F — the theme that transforms the entire song
Bars 3-4: Bb to C — the IV to I cadence with the melody at its peak
Bars 5-8: The theme repeats with richer voicings and higher register melody
teachingGoals: Singing melodic line over supportive chordal accompaniment
Voice leading through chord inversions (C, C/E, F, F/A)
Dynamic shaping of a repeated theme — each pass grows in intensity
styleTips: The melody should sing like a human voice — this is a lament
The first statement is gentle and reflective; the repeat is passionate and full
Use pedal generously to create a warm, connected wash of sound

measures.teachingNote: C major — the iconic melody begins. E-G-A-G, simple and unforgettable.
F major — melody rises to D5. The same contour as bar 1, transposed up. Beautiful symmetry.
Bb major — the melody descends through the flat-VII chord. Rich and warm.
C major — the theme resolves. The melody settles back home before repeating.

measures.rightHand: E4 C5:q G4 D5:q A4 E5:q G4 D5:q
measures.teachingNote: The theme returns with sixths — richer texture. Both voices move in parallel.

measures.rightHand: A4 F5:q C5 G5:q D5 A5:q C5 G5:q
measures.teachingNote: F major — the melody soars an octave higher. This is the emotional peak.

measures.rightHand: D5 Bb5:q C5 A5:q Bb4 G5:q A4 F5:q
measures.teachingNote: Bb major — descending sixths. The passion begins to release.

measures.rightHand: G4 E5:q A4 E5:q G4 E5:h
measures.teachingNote: C major — the coda fades on held thirds. One of rock's most beautiful moments.
